alert.note: Alert for Niihau in Kauai (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 30 at 7:55PM HST until January 30 at 10:30PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: The National Weather Service in Honolulu has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... The island of Kauai in Kauai County * Until 1030 PM HST. * At 755 PM HST, a stream gage near the Hanalei Bridge indicated that water levels remain very high, leading to the continued closure of Kuhio Highway. Rain has ended over the slopes, and water levels will gradually recede, but it may a couple of hours before the roadway it reopened. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Stream Gauges. IMPACT...Flooding in drainages, streams, rivers, roads, properties, and other low-lying areas. Public road closures possible in some areas. Landslides are possible in steep terrain. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Kuhio Highway near Hanalei. This warning may need to be extended beyond 1030 PM HST if flooding persists. FLASH FLOOD...GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, rivers, drainage ditches, and culverts, even if they are currently dry. Do not cross fast flowing or rising water in your vehicle, or on foot. Turn around, don`t drown.
